originalText.text: Favorite Pilates studio with kind and thoughtful staff, along with amazing instructors who help you continue to grow your practice and stay mindful of any injuries. Been coming for over a year and it’s been the best!

text.text: Favorite Pilates studio with kind and thoughtful staff, along with amazing instructors who help you continue to grow your practice and stay mindful of any injuries. Been coming for over a year and it’s been the best!

originalText.text:
I take private instruction with Anca and she changed my life. I hate to work out and do it strictly for health reasons. I have attended classes and worked out with machines and free weights for many years. I took a 1 year hiatus from working out and when I turned 66 this year I knew I had to start exercising again. Doing Pilates on the reformer with Anca as my instructor has changed my life. My aches and pains have gone, I have better balance so I no longer fall and I have much better bladder control so I no longer pee in my pants. (women with kids will understand)
Besides making me physically stronger and balanced it helps me emotionally. I cannot thank Anca enough for her patience and time with me. She is THE BEST!!!

originalText.text: TOTAL SCAM. Beware, this business that lie about their policies when onboarding. I asked specific questions about their policy and was given incorrect information regarding cancelations and the onboarding fee. Very unprofessional and shady. When I brought it to their attention they referred me to the “fine print”.  Also the manager Caitlyn is a real piece of work. She even thought it would be funny to invite me to speak to her at the studio AFTER closing hours. Very rude, very unprofessional. I would not recommend this studio. I would not recommend these packages.

originalText.text: Club Pilates in Murray Street is better than any gym could aspire to be. Big results, minimal to no impact - sign me up! The club is highly inclusive, the staff is supportive and present. They always greet you by name paired with an authentic smile - who says NYC is not friendly? The instructors are top notch, clear and attentive to any injuries or physical pre-conditions you may have. The stations are separated with enough space for everyone to have proper distance, and the machines are thoroughly between classes. The club is always spotless.

originalText.text: I was here once.  I really wondered why I was there.  The instructor was in the corner of the studio on a reformer machine shouting complicated instructions while I was looking for equipment or trying to balance a ball under my head between two pieces of wood, or twisting myself in some incorrect pose trying to comply with the invisible voice in the corner.  It was miserable.  The only thing that saved me was the human being in the reformer next to me who was softly giggling.  God bless her.  Otherwise I would characterize this as a miserable, exercise experience.  I did not see ONE smiling face (except for the nice person next to me).  I think I'll find some other form of misery.
